page.title: 06FARMING..LANDSCAPE CHANGES
page.content: A major change in the area is that most farmers have converted to arable farming, having sold off almost all their livestock and having increased crop growing facilities.Some small changes have occured on the farms themselves, such as the removal of hedges and trees as field boundaries because of death and decay, inconvenience to farm machinery, economic savings if replaced with fences, salt spray off the roads during winter killing them off and tree roots causing field drainage problems.The introduction of new brassica crops has made a change to the appearence of the landscape especially in June when oilseed rape, is in flower, turning fields yellow. Rossie farm uses a 12 year crop cycle.
